ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] Witchcraft
ygData.msgSnippet: This was done by monks, for practical pourposes, to try to integrate christianity into the heathen (note quotations) religions.  Jesus was supposedly born
ygData.messageBody:
This was done by monks, for practical pourposes, to
try to "integrate" christianity into the "heathen"
(note quotations) religions. Jesus was supposedly
born around march 7th or 17th I can't recall which.
And according to the Bible Lucifer was the most
beautiful of angels, it was his pride in said beauty
which led to his downfall. Good to know someone
knows these things anymore. This school as it would
seem is trying to teach wiccan practices without any
foundation in wiccan culture or beliefs, which are a
support for the reason BEHIND the practices. Without
reason or motive, there can be nothing done. Example.
The normans and saxxons killed each other in a bloody
war.
..... It is better to teach their method of warfare
if you know WHY they fought that way, and what started
the war in the first place. I am a supporter of
diversity, and I believe not all men are created equal
but rather different, and we should embrace these
differences and develop them farther, rather than let
them all melt down in one big pot.. well gotta go


--- georgegriffey <no_reply@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> As a follower of "The Craft," I wanted to inform you
> that witchcraft
> IS a religion...in a way. The pagan religion of
> Wicca is often
> referred to as The Craft or Witchcraft. Many of the
> findings of
> witchcraft in other religions have been borrowed
> from Wicca. Such as
> the traditional Easter celebrations. Easter is
> derived from Eostra,
> which is the Wiccan celebration that falls around
> the time of
> Easter. Wiccans would paint eggs to celebrate the
> fertility of the
> goddess. Christmas also borrows traditions from
> Wicca's Yule, which
> falls at the end of December. Even the common
> appearance of Satan
> was pulled from Wicca. When Christianity came to be,
> christians
> portrayed Satan as a demonic creature with horns.
> This was done to
> try to bastardize Wicca, because one of the gods
> worshipped in the
> religion had horns. Of course, this varies from
> practitioner to
> practitioner, as Wicca is a "free-form" religion
> with not many
> things set in stone.
>
> /rant off
>
>
